title: Augusta County: Martha L. Roadcap to John B. McGuffin, July 19, 1861
summary: Martha Roadcap's letter tells of the problems completing the harvest because all men aged 18 to 45 have been drafted. She thanks her son for his prompt letter because reports have become unreliable, and writes him about an accidental shooting in Lexington that killed a Colonel and a 14 year old boy.
keywords: Home Front, Enlistment, Agriculture, Death/Casualties, Women, American Civil War
